text: CLOSE ON: A scrawny MONKEY scratches. ANGLES ON: Defeated, listless ANIMALS, in the bleak envir dilapidated ZOO. WIDER: It is CENTRAL PARK ZOO in depression era NEW YORK. itself is like a GARBAGE DUMP, dotted with squalid SHANTY Against these BLEAK IMAGES, the SOUND of a BRIGHT, BRASSY fades up: Al Jolson, singing "I'm Sitting on Top of the W The sky line of MANHATTAN rises in the background, a grim jungle on this cold FALL day.

LONG continues over: IMAGES: The CROWDED STREETS of NEW YORK ... beneath the b a sense of despair. LONG SOUP LINES snake along the STREETS. The HUNGRY search through RUBBISH BINS for FOOD. SKYSCRAP steadily upwards as more people are evicted from their ho HOMELESS sleep amid steaming VENTS and GARBAGE STREWN GUT
SONG continues over:

SANNY, an old-time VAUDEVILLIAN, hurriedly fixes a large MOUSTACHE on to a YOUNG WOMAN'S TOP LIP ... this is ANN D IMAGES: Weird and wonderful snatches of VAUDEVILLE ACTS f singers, jugglers, boxing ladies.
The COLOR and MUSIC contrast with the SOUP LINES and SLUM SHOULDERS of the REAL WORLD.
ANGLE ON: ANN on STAGE ... dressed as an ELEGANT GENT, sh launches into `I'm Just Wild About Harry' with HARRY, a l than-life PERFORMER dressed in a FRILLY DRESS, BRASSY RED FALSIES.

MANNY's CHARACTER joins in ... SNEEZING LOUDLY and causin take a SUDDEN PRAT FALL. nd so the ROUTINE BUILDS ... ANN and HARRY singing and da ... MANNY SNEEZING ... ANN falling. The AUDIENCE look on with bored expressions on their face except ONE MAN at the BACK, who is LAUGHING HYSTERICALLY. CLOSE ON: ANN throwing everything into her ACT ... SWEAT down her face ... she tries not to get distracted by the WHEEZING MAN. WIDER: A SMATTERING of APPLAUSE from the TINY AUDIENCE. 4 in a THEATRE designed for 500.
CLOSE ON: MANNY in the NOISY, CROWDED DRESSING ROOM, whic of VAUDEVILLE PERFORMERS in various stages of undress. MANNY fires off a loud comical SNEEZE. He looks around at others.
That's a funny one! Isn't that funnier?
It's hysterical, Manny. As long as we're laughing we won't be crying over the box office. Talk about depressing.
ANGLE ON: ANN sitting down at a MIRROR, starting to take VEST ... a book entitled "ISOLATION" by Jack Driscoll lie open on the counter top nearby...
Twenty girls in feather boas prancing around like circus ponies! That's depressing!
ANGLE ON: MAUDE, a BLOWSY SINGER, lighting up a cigarette
(fondly) I love a good chorus line!
CLOSE ON: ANN brushing her HAIR. TAPS, a young tap dancer across and picks up the book.
What's this?
It's a play.
Who wrote it, Annie?
Some guy - Driscoll. reading the jacket of book) From the Federal Theatre.
Don't knock it, honey - at least they get an audience.
It'll pick up .... Ain't that right, Manny?
The DRESSING ROOM goes suddenly quiet ... MANNY looks awa refusing to meet ANN's eye. ANN (cont'd) (trailing off) It always does.
MANNY and ANN emerge from the STAGE DOOR, into an ALLEYWA and winter are setting in ... MANNY splutters out another LOUD SNEEZE.
The trick is to start the build right at the back of your throat... (sneezing comically) Works well out through the nose too.
Have you eaten today?
(sheepish) Oh, I'm not hungry. Don't worry about me.
Hey - you're all I've got.
ANN slips her arm through MANNY'S ... ANN (cont'd) Come on - take me to dinner.
You think the kitchen'll still be open on Third?
Soup and biscuits - perfect.
WIDE ON: The VAUDEVILLE THEATRE. The DOOR is chained clos WORKMEN are up ladders, taking the HOARDINGS down SIGN an a large sign up: THEATRE CLOSED TILL FURTHER NOTICE ...
(calling out to Harry) Hey! Harry, what's going on?
ANGLE ON: ANN ... rattling the HEAVY STEEL CHAINS that ar around the DOORS to the VAUDEVILLE THEATRE ... ANN(cont'd) Hey, open up! We work here.
A WORKMAN up a LADDER smirks down at her.
Not anymore.
A MOTLEY collection of VAUDEVILLE PERFORMERS cluster on t SIDEWALK ... near them an incongruous assortment of PROPS COSTUMES litter the STREET ...
(calling at some WORKMEN) It's all right for you! We haven't had a pay check in two weeks - how we going to eat?
They're not going to get away with this.
LOSE ON: MAUDE looks bleakly at ANN ...
They just did.
ANN tries to gather up PROPS - MANNY's BROOM, her TOP-HAT parasol ...
Ann ... Annie! It's no use.
ANN turns ... Manny is standing quietly to one side. ANNY (cont'd) The show it's over - it's done. 'm done. I'm leaving, Annie ... I'm going back to Chicago. I'm sorry ...
ANGLE ON: ANN stares at MANNY in shock ..
MANNY (cont'd) I'm sorry, Ann. Ever since you were small people have been letting you down. But you gotta think of yourself now. You should try out for that part.

ANN looks at him warily ... MANNY (cont'd) It's what you've always wanted. Oh, I know what you're thinking - every time you reach out for something you care about ... fate comes along and snatches it away.
MANNY, grabs ANN'S hand ... MANNY (cont'd) But not this time, Annie ... not this time.
LOSE ON: ANN as she digests MANNY'S words ... the LOUD ru of an EL TRAIN thunders overhead ...
ANGLE ON: WESTON, a NEW YORK THEATRE PRODUCER, strides ou his office, a copy of VARIETY tucked under his arm ...
(faux nonchalance) Oh, hello Mr. Weston?!
WESTON turns and sees ANN ... he quickens his step.
Oh, Jeez ...
ANGLE ON: ANN falls into step beside WESTON as he hurries along the BUSY SIDEWALK. WESTON (cont'd) Look, Miss ... I told you already; call my office - leave your resume with my secretary.
ANN doggedly follows WESTON ...
Why would I want to do that when we can talk about it in person?
Because that's what a smart girl would do.
But I already sent you my resume - you returned it unopened.
What can I say? Jack Driscoll's very particular about who he works with.
Please, just an audition - that's all I'm asking.
esus - you don't give up, do you?
Mr. Weston, I know this role backwards.
ell, that's too bad - because we just gave the part to someone else. Sorry, kid - the play is cast.

They are standing outside an ITALIAN RESTAURANT ... WESTO enter ... ANN catches a glimpse of PLATES of FOOD and GLASSES of WI quickly looks away. WESTON catches the glance and stops. WESTON (cont'd) Look - I know times are tough. You want my advice? Use what you got. You're not bad looking - a girl like you doesn't have to starve.

HOPE flickers in ANN'S EYES as WESTON fishes into his POC for a PEN and BUSINESS CARD. He scribbles down an address WESTON (cont'd) There's a new place, just opened. (handing to her) Listen, princess - this gig ain't the Palace, you understand? Ask for Kenny K. Tell him I sent you.

WESTON hands her the BUSINESS CARD ... ANN looks down at address, not recognizing it. She looks at him questioning ESTON (cont'd) (evasive) Just play the date, take the money and forget you was ever there.
CLOSE ON: ANN staring down at the piece of paper in her h

LICKERING B&W IMAGES: TIGERS ROARING ... BRUCE BAXTER, in PITH HELMET, stalking through undergrowth ... He raises h rifle and fires! CLICK! The gun is JAMMED. BRUCE turning CAMERA, speaking soundlessly.

CLOSE ON: A SLEEPY looking LION. A PIECE of MEAT is lower into frame ... DENHAM appears briefly holding the MEAT. H attempting to STIR the yawning ANIMAL into life. CAMERA T UP briefly revealing the bars of a CAGE. PRESTON'S FACE a
above a CLAPPER BOARD ... "TAKE 5" LOSE ON: CARL DENHAM sitting in the smoky SCREENING ROOM. is nervous ... his eyes flick from one INVESTOR to the ot trying to read the room.
How much more is there?
Another five reels.
Lights up.
Light floods the room as the washed out image on screen i extinguished. DENHAM notices a sleazy looking INVESTOR wake up with a s
This is it? This is what we get for our forty grand, Denham? Another one of your Safari pictures?
You promised us romantic scenes with Bruce Baxter and Maureen McKenzie.
Come on, fellas - you know the deal - we agreed to push Maureen's start date so she could get her teeth fixed.
It's not the principle of the thing - it's the money.
Carl - you've been in production for over two months -
Trust me, Bruce and Maureen are gonna steam up the screen - once we get them on the ship.
What ship?
The one we've hired to get to the location.
DENHAM hurriedly pulls himself up - as ZELMAN turns on hi
What location? Carl - you're supposed to be shooting on the back-lot.
Yes, I understand that - but fellas, we're not making that film anymore - and I'll tell you why.
DENHAM gets out of his SEAT and moves to the FRONT of the DENHAM (cont'd) The story has changed, the script has been rewritten.

DENHAM turns to face the room, whipping a TATTERED MAP ou pocket. DENHAM (cont'd) Life intervened! I've come into possession of a map. growing excitement) The soul surviving record of an unchartered island, a place that was thought to exist only in myth ... until now!
Whoa! Carl - slow down!
Is he askin' for more money?
He's asking us to fund a wild goose- chase.

I'm talking about a primitive world ... never before seen by man! The ruins of an entire civilisation - the most spectacular thing you've ever seen! (dramatiC pause) That's where I'll shoot my picture!
SILENCE for a beat ... And then -
Will there be boobies?
DENHAM is momentarily SPEECHLESS.
Excuse me, boobies?
Jigglies, jablongers, bazoomers! ... In my experience people only go to these films to observe the ... undraped form of the native girls.

What are you - an idiot? You think they asked De Mille to waste his time on nudie shots? No - they respected the film maker, they showed some class! Not that you'd know what that means - you cheap low-life!
ZELMAN shifts uncomfortably in his seat as THUGGISH shoot ANGRY LOOK.
Would you step outside for a moment, Carl?
DENHAM looks at them ... the INVESTORS avoid EYE CONTACT.

head_text.subj: AS DENHAM STEPS INTO THE LOBBY, PRESTON, HIS LONG SUFFERI

text: DENHAM points suddenly to the GLASS OF WATER on the TABLE PRESTON.
Gimme that - quick!
PRESTON hands him the WATER.
You won't like it, it's non-alcoholic!
DENHAM empties the GLASS into a POT PLANT.
Preston, you have a lot to learn about the motion picture business.
ANGLE ON: DENHAM quietly places the GLASS against the SCR ROOM DOOR, and presses his ear against it.
ZELMAN looks to the INVESTORS.
Don't write him off fellas. He's hot- headed sure, but Carl Denham's made some interesting pictures, he's had a lot of ... near success.
(interrupts) He's a preening self promoter ...
CLOSE ON: DENHAM listening ...
(through the door) ... an ambitious no-talent! The guy has "loser" written all over him.
Look, I understand your disappointment.
He's washed up - It's all over town!
He can't direct. He doesn't have the smarts.
This jumped up little turd's gonna bankrupt us.
The animal footage has value?
Sure ... Universal are desperate for stock footage.
Then sell it! Scrap the picture! We gotta retrieve something from this debacle.
ELMAN nods ... gestures to the YOUNG ASSISTANT.
Get him back in.
ANGLE ON: The YOUNG ASSISTANT opens the DOOR, steps into which is ...
Mr. Denham?
ANGLE ON: DENHAM and PRESTON hurrying down the CROWDED SI struggling under the weight of 8 FILM CANS! DENHAM is gla back over his shoulder.
I want the cast and crew on the ship within the hour.
o Carl, you can't do this!
Tell `em the studio's pressured us into an early departure.
It's not ethical!
hat are they gonna do - sue me? They can get in line! I'm not going to let them kill my film.
ANGLE ON: PRESTON follows DENHAM, who steps off the curb flags a CAB down. He cuts across the BUSY ROAD, PRESTON h behind.
ou realize none of the camera equipment is on board. We have no permits ... no visas ...
hat's why I have you, Preston.
We have no insurance, no foreign currency - in fact, we have no currency of any kind -
ANGLE ON: DENHAM looks back across the STREET and notices INVESTOR heading towards him.
Get in there!
PRESTON suddenly finds himself BUNDLED into the back of a
ho's gonna pay for the ship?
QUICK MOMENT: The SLEAZY INVESTOR grabs at the PARTIALLY WINDOW of the CAB.
Get out of there!
DENHAM hurriedly WINDS the WINDOW SHUT ... the SLEAZY INV yelps with PAIN, as he yanks his JAMMED FINGERS away from
tep on it!
(furious) You're finished, Denham!
ANGLE ON: PRESTON sprawled on the SEAT, amid a PILE of FI as the CAB speeds away!
on't worry Preston - I've had a lot of practice at this: I'm real good at crapping the crappers.
AERIAL WIDE: DENHAM'S CAB cruises along the CROWDED STREE YORK.
And two dozen of Mr. Walker's finest ...
Red label, 80% proof - packed in a crate marked "lemonade".
ANGLE ON: PRESTON and DENHAM sit on the BACK SEAT. PRESTO feverishly scribbling on his NOTEPAD.
You got it ... and tell Maureen - she doesn't have six hours to put on her face. If she wants to be in this picture, she's gotta be on that boat!
She doesn't want to be in this picture.
DENHAM looks at him blankly.
RESTON (cont'd) Maureen pulled out.
She pulled out?!
Yesterday. I told you.
(suspicious thought) You said we were shooting in Singapore, right? That's what you told her?
But we're not shooting in Singapore.
exasperation) Goddammit, Preston! All you had to do is look her in the eye and lie.
DENHAM turns away, his brain whirring ... thinking hard . DENHAM (cont'd) I gotta get to a phone ... talk to Harlow's people.
he`s unavailable.
HIGH WIDE: DENHAM'S CAB wends it's way through BUSY NEW Y streets ...
Myrna Loy? Clara Bow? Mae West?
Mae West?! No! She has to be a size four!
ANGLE ON: PRESTON and DENHAM sit on the BACK SEAT.
ou gotta get a girl who'll fit Maureen's costumes.
(sudden inspiration) Fay's a size four!
es she is, but she is doing a picture with RKO.
DENHAM looks away, muttering to himself ...
ooper huh? (darkly) I might have known.
ANGLE ON: The CAB screeches to a SUDDEN HALT in MID-TRAFF DENHAM jumps out, leaving PRESTON in protest ...
We gotta delay the shoot - shut production down ... We can't sail tonight!
Not an option.
Carl!
I said I'd find a girl.
DENHAM turns and looks at PRESTON briefly. DENHAM (cont'd) For Godsake, Preston - think like a winner. Call Jack ... I need that Goddamn screenplay!
ANGLE ON: DENHAM leans in the window, PRESTON looks on PE DENHAM (cont'd) Defeat is always momentary.
DENHAM bangs the CAB ROOF with his hand, and then strides confidently along the street.
CLOSE ON: A series of PHOTOS of SEMI NAKED WOMEN, with fe boas and peacock fans ... gaudy banners proclaiming Miss ... Delaware Du Boise ... Velvet Cushions ...

IDER: DENHAM is standing outside a tacky BURLESQUE THEATR straightens his tie and heads towards the DOOR. ANGLE ON: A couple of LARGE GIRLS, followed by a SMALLER arrive for work and enter the BURLESQUE THEATRE ... DENHA the BIGGER GIRLS, then chooses to follow the SMALLER ONE. ANGLE ON: DENHAM is reaching for the DOOR HANDLE to go in when he suddenly pauses, his eye caught by the REFLECTION GLASS DOOR ... LOSE ON: ANN ... standing in the MIDDLE of the SIDEWALK. unaware of DENHAM watching her. ANN stares grimly at the HOARDINGS, the FLYER clutched in her hands, a small knot forming in her stomach. LOSE ON: DENHAM's HAND lets go of the DOOR. His eyes lock through the sea of PEDESTRIANS.
ANN angrily CRUMPLES the FLYER, drops it in the GUTTER an
away from the THEATRE. LOSE ON: DENHAM ... watching her leave.

A BUSY FRUIT STALL on the SIDEWALK. The VENDOR is hurried handing out APPLES and pocketing NICKELS. ANGLE ON: ANN walks slowly by ... her eyes on the FRUIT. glances at the VENDOR, SWIPES an APPLE from the TRAY, and moves on, slipping the APPLE into her POCKET. ANN'S arm is suddenly GRABBED! The ANGRY VENDOR pulls her out of her pocket, which is still clutching the stolen ap
(angry) You gonna pay for this?
ANN tries to pull away. The VENDOR's grip on her arm tigh
Excuse me ...
ANGLE ON: DENHAM steps up behind them up HOLDING a NICKEL DENHAM (cont'd) Ma'am, I think you dropped this.
ANGLE ON: THE VENDOR snatches the NICKEL from DENHAM'S fi
ANGLE ON: ANN is eating from a FULL PLATE, trying to disg HUNGER. DENHAM walks over carrying a CUP of COFFEE.
Vaudeville huh? I worked Vaudeville once... that is a tough audience. If you don't kill them fast, they kill you.
Mr. Denham - I want you to know that I'm not in the habit of accepting charity from strangers, or for that matter ... taking things that don't belong to me.
t was obviously a terrible misunderstanding.
It's just that, I haven't been paid in a while ...
mock sincerity) That's awful. Anyway, Ann - may I call you Ann?
DENHAM leans forward ... lowering his voice. DENHAM (cont'd) ... You wouldn't happen to be a size four by any chance?

ANN pauses mid way through a mouthful of food, her appeti suddenly draining away. She abruptly stands. DENHAM (cont'd) No! Oh God, no! You've got me all wrong. Miss Darrow, please! I'm not that type of person at all!
What type of person are you?
I'm someone you can trust, Ann. I'm a movie producer. (sincere) Believe me, I am on the level, no funny business. Please, sit down - Please ... Please.
ANN hesitates a moment before sitting down once again. DENHAM (cont'd) (pitching the film) Ann, I want you to imagine a handsome explorer bound for the Far East.
You're filming in the Far East?
ANGLE ON: DENHAM looking her in the eye and lying.
Singapore. On board ship he meets a mysterious girl. She's beautiful ... she's fragile ... haunted ...

ANN looks up ... caught by the tale DENHAM is weaving. DENHAM (cont'd) She can't escape the feeling that forces beyond her control are compelling her down a road from which she cannot draw back. It's as if her whole life has been a prelude to this moment - this fateful meeting that changes everything. And sure enough, against her better judgement -
She falls in love.
Yes!
But she doesn't trust it. She's not even sure if she believes in love.
Oh really?
If she loves someone - it's doomed.
Why is that?
Good things never last, Mr. Denham.
An awkward pause ... ANN looks away, having revealed too DENHAM considers her a beat, realising something ...
So you're interested?
ANGLE ON: DENHAM hurriedly gathering up his hat and coat. DENHAM (cont'd) That's settled then. I don't want to rush you - but we are under some time pressure here.
Well I really -
Ann? I'm telling you, You're perfect - look at you! You're the saddest girl I ever met ... you're gonna make `em weep, Ann - you're gonna break their hearts!
See, that's where you're wrong, Mr. Denham, I make people laugh, that's what I do.
ANN suddenly STANDS. ANN (cont'd) Good luck with your picture.
DENHAM follows ANN to the DOOR ...
(growing desperation) Ann! Miss Darrow! Please!
I'm offering NHAM(cont'd) DE you money, adventure, fame ... the thrill of a lifetime and a long sea voyage. You wanna read a script? Jack Driscoll's turning in a draft as we speak.
ANN stops and turns. A
Jack Driscoll?
ure. Why - wait! You know him?
Well, no - not personally. I've seen his plays.
DENHAM, sensing her interest, starts to get excited.

What a writer, huh? And let me tell you Ann, Jack Driscoll doesn't want just anyone starring in this picture. He said to me, "Carl, somewhere out there is a woman born to play this role ..." (quiet realization) And as soon as I saw you, I knew -
(uneasy) Knew what?
It was always going to be you.
SLOW PUSH IN on ANN as she realises she is standing on th of a life changing moment.

ANGLE ON: The CROWDED DOCKS ... a clutter of SHIPS and SH TOWNS. A CAB drives onto the DOCKS. DENHAM hops out and h door open for ANN, who emerges carrying a BATTERED SUITCA ANN stares at a LARGE OCEAN GOING LINER that rises above
(awestruck) Is this the moving picture ship?
Not exactly ... it's actually this one over here.
ANGLE ON: DENHAM is striding towards a RUSTY BATTERED TRA STEAMER on the OTHER SIDE of the WHARF! This is "The Vent
DENHAM (cont'd) Don't let appearances deceive you. It's much more spacious on board.
Haul away ...

ROUGH looking SAILORS are working hard to get the boat un Hurried activity everywhere, crates being loaded; smoke b pouring from the stacks ... DENHAM crosses and talks to MIKE and HERB who stand next film gear.
Is this all of the equipment? This is all of it? We're taking the Bell and Howell? Good. You got all the lenses - you got the two and the six?
Carl!
Yes - to MIKE and HERB) Get it on board, fellas. Come on.
NGLE ON: PRESTON hurrying down the GANGWAY. He rushes up DENHAM ... his eyes flick to ANN, but he pulls DENHAM to
(urgent whisper) They're on their way. I've just had word.
Who?
(whisper) Men in uniform. The studio called the cops!
A FLASH of FEAR crosses DENHAM'S FACE ... DENHAM calls ac a TALL FIGURE who is supervising the loading of the ship.
Englehorn! Cast off! Hoist up the mainsail - raise the anchor, whatever the hell it is you do - we gotta leave.
I cannot do that ... we're waiting on the manifest.
What? Who? English - please!
(dryly) Paperwork, Mr. Denham.
DENHAM leans in conspiratorially ...
(low voice) I'll give you another thousand to leave right now.
You haven't given me the first thousand yet.
DENHAM glances at ANN, flustered and embarrassed.
Can we talk about this later. Can't you see we're in the company of a VIP guest?
ENGLEHORN's gaze falls upon ANN ...
Ma'am...
Ann Darrow.
So you are ready for this voyage, Miss Darrow?
Sure...
Nervous?
Nervous - no. Why? Should I be?
ANN looks taken aback ...
It isn't every woman who would take such a risk.
DENHAM throws PRESTON a look!
(hurriedly) Why don't I show Miss Darrow to her cabin?
Wonderful idea, thank you, Preston.
Miss Darrow, if you'd just - Hi, my name is Preston, Carl's assistant.
DENHAM pulls his CHEQUE BOOK from his JACKET POCKET.
Two thousand - it's a deal ... Will you take a cheque?
Do I have a choice?
ANGLE ON: PRESTON goes to lead ANN up the GANG WAY past s looking sailors, onto the SHIP - "THE VENTURE".
Please, follow me. If there's anything that you need ... `excuse me fellas, if there's anything that you need please don't hesitate to ... ask ...
PRESTON turns back to see ANN hesitating at the bottom of WAY ... an unnerved expression on her face ... ANN steps forward ... Deep breath, she follows PRESTON.
BEEFY SAILORS shovel COAL into the SHIP'S FURNACE ... ano cranks a valve on the pistons.
ANGLE ON: DENHAM enters his CABIN looking FLUSTERED. He i STARTLED to find JACK DRISCOLL waiting for him. DRISCOLL WRITER, well dressed in a SHABBY sort of way.
Jesus, Jack - you scared me!

DENHAM crosses to a cabinet and breaks into a CRATE OF JO WALKER. DENHAM (cont'd) Listen, if anyone comes to the door, don't open it. You haven't seen me ... say I got depressed and committed suicide. Say I stuck my head down a toilet! holding up a bottle) You want one?
No! I can't stay, Carl. I have a rehearsal for which I am now ... checks WATCH) ... three hours late.
JACK throws a FEW SCRIPT PAGES across the TABLE.
What's this?
It's the script.
This is a script? Jack ... this is fifteen pages.
I know - but they're good! You've got fifteen good pages there, Carl!
I'm supposed to be making a feature length picture.
You told me I had more time. I'm sorry. Look I gotta go.
Jack - No - you can't do this to me! I have a beginning but I need a middle and an end! I gotta have something to shoot.
The SHIP'S ENGINES roar into life ... JACK stands to leav
You got my notes - I gotta go. See you.

CLOSE ON: DENHAM looking DISMAYED. He stares blankly at t of ACTIVITY through the PORTHOLE WINDOW behind JACK. OV: The VENTURE'S CREW hurriedly RELEASE ROPES in prepara the ship's imminent departure. DENHAM'S expression slowly CHANGES ...
Alright, fine. We might as well settle up.
JACK looks ASTONISHED as DENHAM pulls out his CHEQUE BOOK
You're going to pay me?
I'm not going to stiff a friend.
I've never known you to volunteer cash before ...
How does two grand sound?
Sounds great!
Thought it might.

DENHAM'S eyes flick to the WINDOW ... sees SAILORS are ha the GANGPLANK. NGLE ON: A SAILOR CRANKS a series of VALVES as the SHIP'S crank in to life. DENHAM signs the CHEQUE, and hands it over with a FLOURIS
DENHAM (cont'd) (signing with a flourish) Voila!
JACK snatches the CHEQUE and turns to leave.
Thanks...
JACK glances at it. JACK (cont'd) Carl ... you've written "Two Grand".
DENHAM takes the CHEQUE back ...
So I did ... Sorry about that (screwing it up) Let's start from the beginning. DENHAM (cont'd) (writing) "Two Thousand Dollars" ...
ANGLE ON: The ship's PISTONS PUMP faster. DENHAM looks up at JACK, a confused look on his face. DENHAM (cont'd) It is the 29th, isn't it?
(anxious) Come on - it's the 25th, Carl, the 25th!
ANGLE ON: JACK suddenly realises the SHIP is about to lea
I'm sorry. Let me just ... It'll just take a second.
DENHAM screws up the CHEQUE again! The VIBRATION of the E picks up. JACK heads for the DOOR!
Never mind, pay me when you get back!
(knowing) Alright ... okay ...
CRANE DOWN the stern of the ship as the PROPELLER kicks i action.

NGLE ON: BRUCE BAXTER walking along the CORRIDOR, with PR following behind laden with LUGGAGE. BRUCE is in his earl thirties ... He is QUICK WITTED, SOPHISTICATED and CHARMI but his career as a SCREEN ACTOR has badly stalled.
Your cabin's just down here, Mr. Baxter. May I say how excited we are to have you back with us, Sir.
ANGLE ON: JACK is hurrying down the corridor towards the feels the SHIP MOVING! He suddenly collides with BRUCE, w thrusts a SUITCASE at him.
Be a sport and lend us a hand.
Oh, Christ!
JACK looks desperately out of the PORTHOLE, doubles back AWAY.
(dryly) Appreciate the help, fella.
Let me get the door for you - welcome to your state room sir.
ANGLE ON: BRUCE is clearly unimpressed with the TINY CABI reacts to the SMELL.
know, that's not a nice smell is it? I'm sure it'll disperse in a day or two. Did I ever mention how much I love your work, Mr. Baxter? I've seen every one of your pictures ... even the silent ones.
I haven't made any silent ones.
BRUCE gently closes the DOOR in PRESTON'S FACE - leaving silently CURSING to himself in the CORRIDOR.
ANGLE ON: The PROPELLER CHURNS through the WATER ... ENGLEHORN watches the VENTURE pull away from the dock ... Satisfied, he enters the WHEELHOUSE ...
Dead slow ahead both, Mr Hayes.
Dead slow ahead both, Captain.
ANGLE ON: JACK emerges from the labyrinthine SHIP INTERIO rushes to the RAIL of the SHIP ... he freezes in HORROR!
Oh Christ!
ANGLE ON: The SHIP is PULLING AWAY from the DOCK ... 6 fe 7 feet ... JACK contemplates JUMPING for a MOMENT: JACK (cont'd) Goddammit!
POLICE CARS race along the docks towards the VENTURE, SIR wailing.
JACK SLUMPS on the DECK in DESPAIR. He's missed his chanc get off the ship.

Hayes!
he's taken a pounding ...

Captain! You'd better come up quick!

ANGLE ON: ENGLEHORN, HAYES and JIMMY emerge onto the DECK MILKY LIGHT of DAWN washes over the SHIP. ANGLE ON: JACK as he STARES up at the RUINS ... CLOSE ON: ANN, as if COMPELLED, turns and looks over the the BOAT, into the SEA ... her breathe catches! JIMMY looks up, hollow-eyed ... in his hand is the copy o "HEART OF DARKNESS". HAYES stands nearby. ANGLE ON: JIMMY closing the BOOK, an ashen expression on FACE.
Why does Marlow keep going up the river, why doesn't he turn back?

shrugs) There's a part of him that wants to, Jimmy. A part, deep inside himself that sounds a warning, but there's another part, that needs to know ... that needs to defeat the thing which makes him afraid.

CLOSE ON: HAYES pauses, filled with a sudden sense of DRE reluctantly turns, his eyes drawn to the creepy CARVED HE towering above the SHIP. HAYES v/o "We could not understand, because we were too far ... and could not remember, because we were travelling in the night of First Ages ...
LOSE ON: DENHAM obsessed ... cranking the handle of his C HAYES V/O (cont'd) ... of those Ages that are gone, leaving hardly a sign and no memories ...

DENHAM leads the GROUP across a RICKETY BAMBOO BRIDGE, sp section of BROKEN PATH. They pass BROKEN TOMBS, burial ni containing glimpses of MUMMIES. AHEAD ... DAYLIGHT streams in as they near the end of the STAIRCASE. They make their way over large stone blocks, c in from above ... QUIET, TENSE.

We are accustomed to look upon the shackled form of a conquered monster, but there, there you could look at a thing monstrous and free."

(quiet) It's not an adventure story - is it, Mr. Hayes.
(quiet) No, Jimmy, it's not.

ANGLE ON: DENHAM as he leads the group into the village. SPREAD among the RUINS is a VILLAGE - a crude shanty town by a more recent and far less sophisticated culture ... r GRASS and BAMBOO HUTS. ANGLE ON: PRESTON looking around, UNNERVED ...
It's deserted ...
ANGLE ON: DENHAM cranking the CAMERA as he rolls film on VILLAGE.

At the moment they hear the sound of the SOBBING of a HUM ... ANGLES ON: ANN, PRESTON, JACK, DENHAM, HERB ... not knowi they heard what they just heard ... ROW UPON ROW of sharpened BAMBOO SPIKES line the top of t CLOSE ON: DENHAM ... His eyes suddenly widen in disbelief

ANGLE ON: A SMALL CHILD standing on the DUSTY PATH ahead She stares up at them, with weird FERAL EYES. THE CHILD slowly raises an arm towards the watching GROUP pointing gesture. A suspended moment ... DENHAM steps for

will handle this.
DENHAM pulls a NESTLE BAR from his pocket and walks up to CHILD. DENHAM waves the chocolate around. DENHAM (cont'd) Look chocolate ... you like chocolate?
The CHILD'S EYES drill into DENHAM. RAIN STARTS FALLING. DENHAM (cont'd) Good to eat! Take it ... take it!
The CHILD steps back. DENHAM grabs the CHILD by the wrist attempts to press the chocolate bar into her HAND. The CH struggles and CRIES OUT!

She doesn't want the chocolate!

t's alright - it's just a bunch of women and old folks ... they're harmless.

(chanting) Larri yu sano kore ... Kweh yone kah`weh ad-larr ... tore Kong.

DENHAM punches a NATIVE ... they haul him forward and thr his HEAD onto the BLOOD SPLATTERED STONE ... NATIVE CLUBS into the air ... .. a GUNSHOT! The NATIVES hesitate, as if STUNNED ... then SCATTER. ENGLEHORN, HAYES and an ARMED GROUP of SAILORS race into

Seen enough?

DENHAM is swigging from a HIP FLASK. HERB and PRESTON are gloomily around a TABLE, while DENHAM strides around the swigging and talking in a animated fashion. The STORM BAT CRASHES outside.
We got away. We gotta be grateful for that gentlemen.
What about Mike? He didn't get away - he's still there!
(sharply) Mike died doing what he believed in! He didn't die for nothing. And I'll tell you something else - I'm going to finish this film - for Mike.
I'm going to NHAM(cont'd) donate the DE finish it and proceeds to his wife and kids - because that man is a hero and he deserves nothing less!
Hear! Hear!

ANN alone in her CABIN, is overwhelmed by a terrible SENS FOREBODING ... SUDDENLY! A WAVE crashes against her WINDOW! SHE SPINS AR IN FRIGHT. As she turns slowly she catches sight of her terrified re in the MIRROR.

ANN alone in her CABIN. She looks down and notices her HA TREMBLING. UDDENLY! Her CABIN door starts to rattle. She swings arou FRIGHT, to see cabin's DOOR HANDLE - which is turning ... ANGLE ON: ANN'S FACE as her CABIN DOOR opens ...

Ann!

top! Stop! Turn back, we have to turn back!

WOMEN tie BRACELETS on her wrists.

... report to stations! Jump to it!
ENGLEHORN LIFTS UP THE WINDOW SEAT ... revealing a ROW of GUNS hidden there. ANGLES ON: GUNS are handed out.

he TWO BOATS ROW AWAY from the SHIP, packed with SHIP'S C ... in one BOAT are DENHAM, PRESTON and HERB - clutching EQUIPMENT. ANGLE ON: JACK in the OTHER BOAT, looking GRIM and DETERM

She struggles against the ROPES, to no CLOSE ON: The OLD WOMAN, eyes rolled up in her head. LOSE ON: A NECKLACE is placed over ANN'S head.

ANN catches a BRIEF GLIMPSE of a HUGE DARK SHAPE propelli THROUGH the JUNGLE ... the OILY SMOKE from the FIRES hang air, OBSCURING HER VISION ... she can now only hear the C MOVEMENTS and BREATH as it draws ever closer. ANN cowers back, pulling at her bonds. A MASSIVE SHAPE moves through the air ... The ground SHAK sudden force of IMPACT! text: ANN slowly LOOKS UP, her face filled with DREAD. The SKULL ISLANDERS reply in UNISON ... a piercing WAIL, TOP of the WALL. ANN'S strength suddenly DRAINS from her legs, and SLUMPS the POSTS. Before her is ... KONG! A 25 FOOT TALL MALE GORILLA! KONG stares at ANN for a bea leaning forward on his KNUCKLES ... then prods her with h finger.

CLUTCHING her tightly, KONG carries ANN away from the ALT

(staring upwards) What in God's name was that?
(sudden realisation) Behind the wall!

(disbelief) She's gone!
ACK is hurrying down from the WALL.
She's gone!

CLOSE ON: DENHAM in SHOCK ... his mind racing, fuelled by Gradually his breathing slows and another part of his bra into gear. JACK makes brief eye contact with DENHAM, who quickly loo JACK (cont'd) Carl? What is it? (realizing) You saw something ...

You can take Hayes and fifteen others. I'll put a guard on the gate until you return ... The rest of you, stay with the ship.
JACK grabs his PACK and WALKS away TOWARDS THE GATE, with JIMMY following.
Not you, Jimmy.
Com'on Mr. Hayes, look at `em. None of them knows a which way to point a gun.
HAYES takes the RIFLE out of JIMMY'S HANDS.
Stay here.
Miss Darrow needs me!
No!

(quietly) Bring the tripod - and all of the film stock.
You wanna go with the six inch lens?
The wide angle will do just fine.
CLOSE ON: PRESTON slings the FILM STOCK BAG over his SHOU ANGLE ON: JACK, PRESTON, HAYES, LUMPY, CHOY, BRUCE and 8 as ENGLEHORN surveys the GROUP. DENHAM and HERB are HAULI EQUIPMENT.
You got guns, you got food, you got ammo. You got twenty-four hours.
Twenty-four hours?
This time tomorrow we haul anchor.

WIDE ON: The VOLCANIC ROCKS form a JAGGED, TORTURED LANDS DEEP CREVASSES and TOWERING CLIFFS. The vegetation is THI JUNGLE DARK. ANCIENT GNARLED TREES twist out of the groun LICHEN and long MOSSES hang from branches and TANGLED VIN RISES from festering SWAMPS ...

HAYES is LEADING DENHAM, JACK, PRESTON, LUMPY, CHOY, BRUC EIGHT SAILORS. HERB is limping along with the heavy CAMER shoulder. The atmosphere is TENSE ... unseen creatures scurry in th darkness, fleeing from the approaching humans. HAYES puts his hands up ... the GROUP stops ... a STRANGE MOAN echoes from the SURROUNDING JUNGLE ... The MEN stare darkness ... watchful, on edge ...

CLOSE ON: ANN in KONG'S HAND, being tossed around like a as KONG RUNS through the FOREST. She is FLUNG wildly a KONG BOUNDS across CHASMS, LEAPING over rivers. ANN'S FEVERED POV: The JUNGLE SPINNING and BLURRING by. S to brace herself against KONG'S FINGERS, but the rigors o journey knock her sideways like a RAG DOLL. WIDE ON: SHAFTS of MOONLIGHT play on the faces of grotesq STATUES set into a MOSSY CLIFF. ANGLE ON: ANN clutched tightly in KONG'S HAND. She is rig FEAR. KONG squats down ... he LOOKS CLOSELY at ANN. CLOSE ON: KONG ... we see him clearly for the first time. old, brutish BULL GORILLA. Years of survival have left SC his face. One EYE LID is mangled and his JAW is CROOKED . leaving a huge yellowed INCISOR TOOTH jutting up. KONG stares at ANN ... she dare not move; only her RAPID belies her INNER TERROR. ANGLE ON: ANN is suddenly swung UPSIDE DOWN and SHAKEN .. ceremonial NECKLACE falls from ANN'S NECK. CLOSE ON: ANN'S HORRIFIED FACE ... she sees HUMAN REMAINS the NECKLACES! Bones ... skulls! A WHIMPERING SOUND escap the back of her throat. SWIRLING UPSIDE DOWN POV: The NECKLACE lands on the groun DOZENS of OTHER NECKLACES littering the clearing. ANGLE ON: ANN is lifted UPWARDS ... KONG'S LIPS curl in a slow SNARL. ANN looks at KONG, aghast, and in this moment her heighte of FEAR gives way to something more fundamental: SELF

KONG'S FINGERS start to OPEN - ANN seizes her chance! She PROPELS herself off his HAND! ANN DROPS 12 feet and lands at KONG'S FEET. She rolls amongst grinning HUMAN SKULLS a BONES ... staggers to her feet and RUNS! KONG rises up with a ROAR, but ANN is already disappearin the JUNGLE!

TREES are FALLING, KONG is smashing through the underg after her! ANGLE ON: With surprising AGILITY and GRACE, KONG sweeps above and SCOOPS ANN off the ROCK. She barely has time to before being CARRIED AWAY, as KONG disappears into the DE the ISLAND.

Ann!

ANGLE ON: JACK starts RUNNING towards the SOUND. DENHAM a OTHERS follow ... JACK is barging through THICK TANGLED VEGETATION, which is growing between huge moss covered FA COLUMNS. KONG'S ENRAGED ROAR echos through the JUNGLE. JACK (cont'd) (yelling) Ann!
ANGLE ON: The GROUP pause at the sound of ANN'S TERRIFIED CLOSE ON: JACK'S ashen face.
ONG LEAPS ACROSS CHASMS as he CARRIES ANN through the JUN

Christ! It's a bleeding bone yard! (horrified realization) They've been ripped limb from limb.
(calling) ANN! Ann!

esus, Jimmy!
HAYES snatches the GUN off him ...
defiant) Hey! I need that!
(angry) I'm not giving you a gun!
You were younger than me when they gave you one!
I was in the army. I was trained - I had a drill sergeant!

quietly) I just wanna help bring her back.
HAYES's expression softens. He hands the gun back to JIMM
Don't make me regret it.

ANGLE ON: The GROUP'S NERVES are FRAYED ... as they conti slogging through the difficult TERRAIN. HUGE INSECTS fly them, AND THE GROUP try in vain to SWAT them away. ANGLE ON: LUMPY shooting WILDLY at a HUGE BUG ...
growling) Conserve your ammunition!
LUMPY GLARES at HAYES ... and SHOOTS one last time at a H ON A NEARBY TREE ...

ANGLE ON: SLIDING FEET ... down a VINE strewn slope. ULL BACK to reveal ... the GROUP have emerged from the JU into a NARROW VALLEY, deep in the heart of SKULL ISLAND . VALLEY is less than 75 feet wide, flanked by sheer CLIFFS JACK looks up and down the VALLEY ... he wipes his brow . SUN is high, it is hot out of the SHADE. ANGLE ON: LUMPY stumbling forward with a hacking SMOKER'S
I'm knackered! I've gotta have a breather.

She lean and picks up some STONES ... JUGGLING them, attempting to him as she did before. KONG's gaze remains averted ... He looks out over the JUNGLE CANOPY. ANN follows his GAZE in the RUGGED LANDSCAPE which is bathed in the last EVENI of the SUN. She stares out to sea, a RAIN CLOUD casts sha the OCEAN.
(softly) It's beautiful.
KONG sits QUIETLY staring out over the JUNGLE ... she loo him. ANN (cont'd) Beautiful.
ANN places her HAND against her heart. ANN (cont'd) Beau-ti-ful.
KONG'S BIG PAW unfurls beside ANN ... she hesitates for a then CLIMBS into it. ANGLE ON: KONG gently lifts ANN ...

CHASM ... TWO SAILORS reaching down to help him.

Don't thank God, thank Mr. Baxter ...
CLOSE ON: BRUCE PULLING HIMSELF UP THE ROPE, gasping from exertion. ENGLEHORN (cont'd) He insisted on a rescue mission. Me? I knew you'd be okay ...

CLOSE ON: DENHAM looks up to see ENGLEHORN standing at th the CHASM. ENGLEHORN is watching him IMPASSIVELY. ENGLEHORN (cont'd) That's the thing about cockroaches; no matter how many times you flush them down the toilet they always crawl back up the bowl!
ANGLE ON: DENHAM as he rises to his feet.
ey buddy! I'm outta the bowl! I'm drying off my wings and trekking across the lid!

Driscoll ... don't be a fool! Give it up, it's useless ... She's dead.
(quietly) She's not dead. Jack's gonna bring her back.
ENGLEHORN turns to DENHAM.
DENHAM (cont'd) And the ape will be hard on his heels. We can still come out of this thing okay - (pause) More than okay. Think about it, you've got a boat full of chloroform we can put to good use.
ENGLEHORN looks at DENHAM for a BEAT and then LAUGHS.
You want to trap the Ape? I don't think so.
Isn't that what you do? Live animal capture? I heard you were the best.
ENGLEHORN stares at DENHAM for a moment, it is impossible what he is thinking. DENHAM (cont'd) Jack!
JACK looks at DENHAM D ... DENHAM raises a hand in salute. DENHAM (cont'd) (calling) Look after yourself!
Keep the Gate open.
Sure thing, buddy! Good luck!
ANGLE ON: JACK turns to go ... and disappears up the DARK DENHAM (cont'd) I'm sorry.

He scans the LAIR for any sign of ANN ... but can't see h OLD BONES of a LARGE GORILLA lie across the CAVE from JAC ACK CLIMBS higher INTO THE CAVE until at last he's on THE WITH KONG. For a MOMENT she stares blankl ... then REALISATION arrives quickly - he has come for he looks at JACK with disbelief. Ann ... He'll kill you!

Let go of me ...

Go back!

Hold her!

Wait!
ENGLEHORN ignores him, intent on killing KONG with his ne HARPOON.

Leave him alone!

But she can longer help him ... she has failed to stop this happening CLOSE ON: ANN turns away from KONG ... as he slumps into unconsciousness. CLOSE ON: ANN and JACK make EYE CONTACT across the water starts to CRY. JACK is unable to offer her any comfort. ANGLE ON: DENHAM steps up to the UNCONSCIOUS KONG:
he whole world will pay to see this. We're millionaires, boys. I'll share it with all of you! In a few months his name will be up in lights on Broadway! "Kong - the Eighth Wonder of the World"!

n EXCITED and CURIOUS CROWD are converging on the THEATRE are pulling up ... a QUEUE is forming ... SCALPERS are se tickets outside the door. LOSE ON: BILLBOARDS outside the THEATRE proclaim "Relive adventure of the Century ... see Miss Ann Darrow offered Beast!"

Look at yourself! Look at what you've become!

No woman is worth this!

Shuddup and hand me the grapefruit.

EDGAR proceeds to stuff a LARGE GRAPEFRUIT down his BRASS THE AUDIENCE BREAKS into LAUGHTER. PULL FOCUS to reveal: JACK sitting behind the WOMAN, inte watching the stage ... ANGLE ON: JAYNE a BLONDE ACTRESS who looks similar to ANN THELMA, her CONFIDANT, entering THE HOTEL LOBBY from the side of the STAGE ...
Tell me everything - every little detail!
They sit on a SOFA as EDGAR takes a seat in an ARMCHAIR n
So, he took me to a fancy French restaurant ...
French, huh?
Anyway about half way through the whore derves - he clutches my hand ...
He clutches your hand?!
(falsetto) It felt like the right thing to do at the time. (falsetto) Oh! I'm sorry - I couldn't help but over-hear!
The TWO WOMEN look at him a beat before turning back to e other.
He's looking into my eyes -
And that's when he told you how he felt?
No - he never said it.
He never said it?!
(falsetto) He probably thought he didn't need to say it.
Then how does she know that it's real?
He said it was not about the words.
Please - if you feel it, you say it. It's really very simple.
He said we'd talk about it later. Only there was no later ...
CAMERA PUSHES IN on JACK .... AYNE (cont'd) It never happened. (reflective) I just thought that maybe this one time, things might actually work out - which was really very ...
LOSE ON: JACK, hearing his own words ...
... foolish ....
UDDENLY JACK stands and making his way past surprised MEMBERS, heads for the EXIT.
